titleStmt.title: G. Higgins et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2785

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Independence Ky
Kenton County April 26th 1862
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky.

The undersigned citizens of the third Magisterial district in this county would respectfully recomend for your consideration Zebulon Springer as a person well qualified to fill the office of Justice of the peace for said district and one who would give general satisfaction to the people. -- and we respectfully ask his appointment by you to that office till the next general election, to fill the vacancy therein occasioned by the death of Henson. Wayman esqr. -- for which Your petitioners in duty bound will ever pray.

G. Higgins M. T. J.
Wm H Taylor
Geo W Ragan
J M Chambers M. D.
W. A. Bryson
A T Cain
L Shaw co atty
F. M. Norhtcutt P. M.
C. J. Taylor
Reuben McDunnold
Luciean B. Heymer
Wm E Pool C K C
C. C. Brigson M.D.
J G Story
M T Stephens
F B. Frendy
James Acre
H Picket
S. J Fulton
Jef Fulton
John Minter
William Brown
C.H. Cain
